newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak FinMin sets two state securities auctions.
newsitem.headline: Slovak FinMin sets two state securities auctions.

text.p: The Slovak Finance Ministry will auction an unspecified amount of one-year state bonds on April 22, the National Bank of Slovakia said on Monday.
The NBS added in a statement that the ministry will also auction an unspecified amount of 26-week treasury bills on April 16, its first paper with such a maturity this year.

The one-year bonds will carry a fixed annual coupon rate of 10.00 percent. The ministry does not set a limit price for bids at state securities auctions, nor does it set the amount of bonds on the offer.
In the last successful auction of one year-state bonds on March 25, the average yield rose to 14.88 percent from 14.66 percent in the last auction of similar bonds on February 25.
Ministry officials were not immediately available for further comment.

The longest maturity of T-bills auctioned this year was 13-weeks on April 9. Average yield in the auction rose to 14.84 percent from 13.963 percent in the previous successful auction of similar T-bills on January 23.
